subject: Release Notes for 0.17.3
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-18 11:59:49.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst'], 'message': "Release Notes for 0.17.3

ffd135c Updated from global requirements
fab2ace Updated from global requirements
68cf63d Don't get the image before deleting it
15fe21d Updated from global requirements
e7a801d Ship the default image schema in the client
320bc6f V2: Do not validate image schema when listing
0acf7cc Expose 'is_base' schema property attribute

commit_message:
Release Notes for 0.17.3

ffd135c Updated from global requirements
fab2ace Updated from global requirements
68cf63d Don't get the image before deleting it
15fe21d Updated from global requirements
e7a801d Ship the default image schema in the client
320bc6f V2: Do not validate image schema when listing
0acf7cc Expose 'is_base' schema property attribute

Change-Id: Icc2f9108276747ea6324e410d56c7b73f1048562

commit_message:
Add functional runtime tests

This adds a set of tests that actually execute Bandit and validate
that the output and return codes being generated are as expected.

The intial tests included here can be expanded once we confirm that
this approach is suitable.

Change-Id: I7d44a39337bdd16bfcfb56b639b2f65fd64cb12f

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1528, 'name': 'Stanislaw Pitucha', 'email': 'viraptor@gmail.com', 'username': 'stanislaw-pitucha'}, {'_account_id': 8122, 'name': 'Cyril Roelandt', 'email': 'cyril@redhat.com', 'username': 'cyril.roelandt.enovance'}, {'_account_id': 9107, 'name': 'Victor Stinner', 'email': 'vstinner@redhat.com', 'username': 'haypo'}, {'_account_id': 11029, 'name': 'Jamie Finnigan', 'email': 'jamiefinnigan@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamiefinnigan'}, {'_account_id': 11716, 'name': 'Tim Kelsey', 'email': 'timothy.kelsey@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'tkelsey'}, {'_account_id': 11861, 'name': 'Travis McPeak', 'email': 'tmcpeak@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'travis-mcpeak'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}, {'_account_id': 13962, 'name': 'Victor Ryzhenkin', 'email': 'vryzhenkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vryzhenkin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-16 09:56:48.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_bandit_conf_generator.py', 'bandit/bandit_config_generator.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Add a configuration generator for bandit

This allows project developers to generate a valid configuration for their
project, that can easily be updated. Example of use:

$ cat oslo_messaging.yaml
profile_name: gate
exclude_checkers: [assert_used, try_except_pass]

$ bandit_config_generator.py \
    --out /tmp/bandit.yaml \
    bandit.yaml \
    oslo_messaging.yaml

Change-Id: I0b678b26ffa7dbe6034bdc7b35862e15c61c3670
Blueprint: bandit-conf-generator
'}]
commit_message:
Add a configuration generator for bandit

This allows project developers to generate a valid configuration for their
project, that can easily be updated. Example of use:

$ cat oslo_messaging.yaml
profile_name: gate
exclude_checkers: [assert_used, try_except_pass]

$ bandit_config_generator.py \
    --out /tmp/bandit.yaml \
    bandit.yaml \
    oslo_messaging.yaml

Change-Id: I0b678b26ffa7dbe6034bdc7b35862e15c61c3670
Blueprint: bandit-conf-generator

commit_message:
Avoid the dual-naming confusion

The module 'event' is an import and it is also
a function argument name in this function, this
can be confusing so rename it to be named differently
in the function.

commit_message:
Fix gate-fuel-docs-docs CI job

* Add tox.ini, setup.cfg and setup.py to allow docs building
using tox and setuptools
* Set doc/build as an output dir in setup.cfg to allow doc
publishing by gate-fuel-docs-docs job
* Add '.tox' and '*egg' paths to exclude_patterns in conf.py
* Add stub index.rst with basic info and link to the web verstion
of the docs to fix building of manpages
* Add '.tox' dir to .gitignore

Change-Id: Iaec750d6035bd0e30c10a12142be35514df1fb15

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-16 10:53:24.000000000', 'files': ['etc/neutron.conf', 'neutron/agent/dhcp/config.py', 'neutron/common/config.py', 'etc/dhcp_agent.ini'], 'message': 'Revert "Move dhcp_lease_duration into DHCP agent config options list"

This reverts commit 3101e2b62f0741baffc61174637486da17dd29bb.

The lease duration isn't DHCP agent specific. DHCP is a feature that
should be provided by whatever plugin is loaded and operators would
still like to set lease times for DHCP.

In the reference implementation we just consume it directly in the

Change-Id: I5efb6aa5e196d4cac5ff7c0c35be5a350401b925

commit_message:
Revert "Move dhcp_lease_duration into DHCP agent config options list"

This reverts commit 3101e2b62f0741baffc61174637486da17dd29bb.

The lease duration isn't DHCP agent specific. DHCP is a feature that
should be provided by whatever plugin is loaded and operators would
still like to set lease times for DHCP.

In the reference implementation we just consume it directly in the
agent, but that doesn't mean it's specific to the agent implementation.

Change-Id: I5efb6aa5e196d4cac5ff7c0c35be5a350401b925

commit_message:
Remove "../../etc/kolla" from synced folders in Vagrant

That sync broke copying configuration files in Ansible playbooks
and made all changes of configuration inside VM as a change in
kolla git repo on host.

Change-Id: I21ecd9a48c0c3263c05f5dbefea7bbc78a919f0a
Closes-Bug: #1515901

subject: Make sure Facter is only executed on agent
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-12 23:10:34.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/type/swift_object_expirer_config.rb'], 'message': 'Make sure Facter is only executed on agent

  This commit moves conditionals based on values obtained from Facter
  inside code blocks that are only executed on agents and replaces
  the use of Facter['osfamily'].value with Facter.value:(:osfamily).

  Without this change we are returning values based off the master's
  facts, so if a Debian agent checks into a RedHat master then the type
  is currently making a decision based off of RedHat and not the actual
  OS of the agent running the catalog.  Code ran outside blocks is
  evaluated on masters and inside a block is evaluated by the agent when
  the catalog is executed.  We do not notice this because all our
  testing uses "puppet apply" and autorequire only matters when they
  find a matching resource name in the catalog.  The latter results
  in no error because the relationship is simply ignored on the Debian
  agent if a package resource with the RedHat name is not found.

  This issue was found by running facter 3, the C++11 re-implementation
  under the jruby and clojure implemented puppetserver.  The clojure
  jni shim written so that facter can be ran inside of puppetserver does
  not implement the [] method for the Facter module but the ruby shim
  does.  So I noticed that the code had an issue when
  Facter['osfamily'].value was executed on the master, which returned a
  not method error.  Once again, something we didn't notice becuase we
  do not test against a master.  I decided to migrate to
  Facter.value(:osfamily) to simply keep to an API that is consistent
  across both puppet and puppetserver but fixing where the code runs
  does actually solve the not method found error.

Change-Id: I24b0b20b2839c7bc33a76ac14849783f2285579f
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure Facter is only executed on agent

  This commit moves conditionals based on values obtained from Facter
  inside code blocks that are only executed on agents and replaces
  the use of Facter['osfamily'].value with Facter.value:(:osfamily).

  Without this change we are returning values based off the master's
  facts, so if a Debian agent checks into a RedHat master then the type
  is currently making a decision based off of RedHat and not the actual
  OS of the agent running the catalog.  Code ran outside blocks is
  evaluated on masters and inside a block is evaluated by the agent when
  the catalog is executed.  We do not notice this because all our
  testing uses "puppet apply" and autorequire only matters when they
  find a matching resource name in the catalog.  The latter results
  in no error because the relationship is simply ignored on the Debian
  agent if a package resource with the RedHat name is not found.

  This issue was found by running facter 3, the C++11 re-implementation
  under the jruby and clojure implemented puppetserver.  The clojure
  jni shim written so that facter can be ran inside of puppetserver does
  not implement the [] method for the Facter module but the ruby shim
  does.  So I noticed that the code had an issue when
  Facter['osfamily'].value was executed on the master, which returned a
  not method error.  Once again, something we didn't notice becuase we
  do not test against a master.  I decided to migrate to
  Facter.value(:osfamily) to simply keep to an API that is consistent
  across both puppet and puppetserver but fixing where the code runs
  does actually solve the not method found error.

Change-Id: I24b0b20b2839c7bc33a76ac14849783f2285579f

empty. Aggregate Extra Specs Filter checks if extra specs attribute

commit_message:
Aggregate Extra Specs Filter should return if extra_specs is empty

Aggregate Extra Specs Filter should return if extra_specs is
empty. Aggregate Extra Specs Filter checks if extra specs attribute
is present as part of filter_properties; if it is not the filter
doesn't proceed further. But the filter tries to proceed further even
if the extra_specs attribute is present but its empty which should
not be done. This patch tries to fix the scenario where 'extra_specs'
is empty.

Change-Id: I23de8f5f45416c81e36e19bafb41e8c66c2ebd5c
Closes-Bug: #1512511

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-15 14:22:48.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/cmd/usage_audit.py'], 'message': "usage_audit: Fix usage_audit to work with ML2

The script didn't work with the ML2 plugin as router related
functionality is moved to the L3 router service plugin. The fix assumes
that the L3 router service plugin is in use, and this seems to apply to
most of the current core plugins.

Change-Id: If3eb7bde4a5b8b9ca2ac0bd7327325f6c0ad620a
Closes-Bug: 1481692
(cherry picked from commit 2bded62d6a6a141e610a06e5f40bb28c0b26da5c)
"}]
commit_message:
usage_audit: Fix usage_audit to work with ML2

The script didn't work with the ML2 plugin as router related
functionality is moved to the L3 router service plugin. The fix assumes
that the L3 router service plugin is in use, and this seems to apply to
most of the current core plugins.

Change-Id: If3eb7bde4a5b8b9ca2ac0bd7327325f6c0ad620a
Closes-Bug: 1481692
(cherry picked from commit 2bded62d6a6a141e610a06e5f40bb28c0b26da5c)

subject: Install base packages only to base chroot buildrpm image
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-17 09:16:53.000000000', 'files': ['packages/rpm/module.mk'], 'message': "Install base packages only to base chroot buildrpm image

Let's install only base packages (into chroot), required by
rpm packages build. The rest of the packages should come from
BuildRequires section.
This will allow us to prepare late artifacts a little bit faster
in case of BUILD_PACKAGES=0

Change-Id: Ica432b3c5e80ac9e6fbda4030a07b312732c4a29
"}]
commit_message:
Install base packages only to base chroot buildrpm image

Let's install only base packages (into chroot), required by
rpm packages build. The rest of the packages should come from
BuildRequires section.
This will allow us to prepare late artifacts a little bit faster
in case of BUILD_PACKAGES=0

Change-Id: Ica432b3c5e80ac9e6fbda4030a07b312732c4a29

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-18 10:19:56.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_direct_workflow.py', 'mistral/workflow/direct_workflow.py'], 'message': "Fixing workflow execution state calculation

 when it didn't take to account conditional
 transitions (Error was considered handled even
 if transition doesn't trigger a task)

Closes-Bug: #1510936

Change-Id: Ia694b6dba9ab2ce9bff2da1fe05f5988864619d9
(cherry picked from commit 6662bec3140de91cf2329060e4e3867f2c2859ce)

commit_message:
Fixing workflow execution state calculation

 * Fixed workflow execution state calculation
 when it didn't take to account conditional
 transitions (Error was considered handled even
 if transition doesn't trigger a task)

Closes-Bug: #1510936

Change-Id: Ia694b6dba9ab2ce9bff2da1fe05f5988864619d9
(cherry picked from commit 6662bec3140de91cf2329060e4e3867f2c2859ce)

subject: Bug fix while editing actions with missing keys
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-18 11:09:27.000000000', 'files': ['disaster_recovery/actions/views.py', 'disaster_recovery/api/api.py'], 'message': 'Bug fix while editing actions with missing keys

If a key is not present in the database, the panel failed to open the modal
windows for edition, this fix that by using the dict.get()

Change-Id: Ic5f5e216828f10d41f288408fc5109dc004c6ab8
'}]
commit_message:
Bug fix while editing actions with missing keys

If a key is not present in the database, the panel failed to open the modal
windows for edition, this fix that by using the dict.get()

Change-Id: Ic5f5e216828f10d41f288408fc5109dc004c6ab8

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-11-17 14:42:34.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/common/templates/rsyslog.conf.j2', 'docker/logging/rsyslog/extend_start.sh', 'ansible/roles/common/templates/rsyslog.json.j2', 'docker/logging/rsyslog/rsyslog_sudoers', 'docker/logging/rsyslog/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': "Drop root for rsyslog

This change ensures commands run in the rsyslog container are done as the
'rsyslog' user rather than root.

* Needed to disable the imklog (kernel logging) module as it requires
  root, I don't believe that we need it in our containers anyhow.

* Moving the syslog pid from /var/run to ~rsyslog

* Changing group on /dev and /var/log from root to the kolla group. I'm
  not aware of any repercussions from doing this but if there are
  please shout.

Reference from http://wiki.rsyslog.com/index.php/Security

Change-Id: Icf58703022498c06767815f7af013e9593bda81d
Partially-Implements: blueprint drop-root
"}]
commit_message:
Drop root for rsyslog

This change ensures commands run in the rsyslog container are done as the
'rsyslog' user rather than root.

* Needed to disable the imklog (kernel logging) module as it requires
  root, I don't believe that we need it in our containers anyhow.

* Moving the syslog pid from /var/run to ~rsyslog

* Changing group on /dev and /var/log from root to the kolla group. I'm
  not aware of any repercussions from doing this but if there are
  please shout.

Reference from http://wiki.rsyslog.com/index.php/Security

Change-Id: Icf58703022498c06767815f7af013e9593bda81d
Partially-Implements: blueprint drop-root

commit_message:
Add transaction for setting agent_id in L3HARouterAgentPortBinding

To avoid having extra L3HARouterAgentPortBinding with l3_agent as
None, operation of setting l3_agent should be atomic.
For this purpose, transaction was added in methods
create_ha_port_and_bind and _bind_ha_router_to_agents.

Closes-Bug: #1499647

Change-Id: Iaad82fe522cfd70061daecf411c924fdc11b7e41
(cherry picked from commit 3fef15a40b2714c1a372216ce60cc1384dc48c02)

commit_message:
Verify galera is sync'd in yum_update.sh

When the cluster is brought back online after a yum update in
yum_update.sh, we should verify that galera is fully sync'd before
moving on. This ensures the sync is complete before moving on to update
any other nodes in the cluster.

Change-Id: Ie8fc2c5d5214deacea94ca658ac75359b318ced1

commit_message:
Dropping logrotate.conf for all Openstack aggregate logs

This fix will add a logrotate configuration file for each host
including all log files found under /openstack/log.
All log files are rotated using copytruncate, so no service needs to
be restarted after the rotation.
This was implemended to mimic the kilo implementation, hence using the same
file name for the logrotate configuration, so it'll updated as part of the
kilo upgrade.

Change-Id: Ifb180bf5e1dd17c5ee3bdbfda54f7b469d1e4daf
Closes-Bug: #1516697

commit_message:
Reuse existing registry and/or existing template

Extend the "-x" option on CLI for the stack update to reuse the
existing registry and existing template saved in the database
for a stack. This allows the users to optionally omit the
environment and/or template when specifying the "-x" option.
The environment and template can be specified or omitted
independently of other options.
Usage:
Reuse the existing template and use the new environment:
  heat stack-update mystack -x -e mynewenv.yaml
Reuse the existing template and environment:
  heat stack-update mystack -x
Use the new template and reuse the existing environment:
  heat stack-update mystack -x -f mynewtemplate.yaml
Use the new template and environment:
  heat stack-update mystack -x -f mynewtemplate.yaml -e mynewenv.yaml

Partial-Bug: 1224828
Change-Id: I755c923e74561520aca3da630408c9a2f37139fb
Depends-On: I7df4eb107881b673bf5733bbc2d4cc3d9a319d21

commit_message:
Don't run gate-horizon-dsvm-integration on stable branches

This job is non-voting and the Horizon team is working to get it voting
on master but it still looks to be unstable. Given it's non-voting and
not yet stable in master, let's not waste test resources running an
unreliable non-voting job on stable branches.

Change-Id: I284d9f597839801480f2ce0d04bf7d41d0281a45

In databases that actually support foreign keys (like MySQL),
we need to delete everything linking to a node before deleting a node.

Change-Id: I320d8547697c3c13b7acb2e3fee117347550e264
Closes-Bug: #1511187
(cherry picked from commit 9c62b95ffade6f289138b9096027c87196dd8258)
'}]
commit_message:
Properly order node deletion from cache

In databases that actually support foreign keys (like MySQL),
we need to delete everything linking to a node before deleting a node.

Change-Id: I320d8547697c3c13b7acb2e3fee117347550e264
Closes-Bug: #1511187

commit_message:
Fixing workflow execution state calculation

 * Fixed workflow execution state calculation
 when it didn't take to account conditional
 transitions (Error was considered handled even
 if transition doesn't trigger a task)

Closes-Bug: #1510936

Change-Id: Ia694b6dba9ab2ce9bff2da1fe05f5988864619d9

commit_message:
Fixing wf execution creation at initial stage

 * Wf execution is not created when first
   task(s) failed.
 * Fixed some unit-tests.

Closes-Bug: #1506470

This patch documents two new root device hints recently added to
Ironic-Python-Agent: wwn_with_extension and wwn_vendor_extension. Since
some SCSI devices use the same WWN those other two WWN can be used to
guarantee uniqueness when searching for the root device to deploy the
image onto.

Depends-On: Ic3e9a1111dfcc99702190c173562a0dccf5f94c4
Related-Bug: #1516641
Change-Id: I1d07441999327a75e5178fc9d365c81b87a60437
'}]
commit_message:
Add and document two new root device hints: wwn_{with, vendor}_extension

This patch documents two new root device hints recently added to
Ironic-Python-Agent: wwn_with_extension and wwn_vendor_extension. Since
some SCSI devices use the same WWN those other two WWN can be used to
guarantee uniqueness when searching for the root device to deploy the
image onto.

Depends-On: Ic3e9a1111dfcc99702190c173562a0dccf5f94c4
Related-Bug: #1516641
Change-Id: I1d07441999327a75e5178fc9d365c81b87a60437

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-20 11:46:47.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_vmware/rw_handles.py'], 'message': 'Fix exception during connection close

Patch to address exceptions during connection close in various
handles in rw_handles due to non-existing attributes. This can
happen if close is called after a connection failure.

Change-Id: I088e53a10d7f7f87757e2930cdffedd3ae897b7e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix exception during connection close

Patch to address exceptions during connection close in various
handles in rw_handles due to non-existing attributes. This can
happen if close is called after a connection failure.

Change-Id: I088e53a10d7f7f87757e2930cdffedd3ae897b7e

commit_message:
RST tables: workaround problem with empty values

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/246766/ for the os-doc-tools patch.

Without a workaround of this type, sphinx generates warnings (and errors
in our setup) because of lines not ending as expected.

Change-Id: Ica62ee532745aa21774460b30bea2c4c603388cd

subject: Sort root device hints when parsing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-17 14:31:31.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/deploy_utils.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_deploy_utils.py'], 'message': 'Sort root device hints when parsing

In order to have a predicable string to test function parsing the root
device hints we need to sort the list. I understand that this is
changing code to help with tests but tests are important and since root
device hints is just a handful of hints it should have no performance
impact in the code.

Change-Id: I7211cab3af9e9974a6ea92fc8933b73ef842829b
'}]
commit_message:
Sort root device hints when parsing

In order to have a predicable string to test function parsing the root
device hints we need to sort the list. I understand that this is
changing code to help with tests but tests are important and since root
device hints is just a handful of hints it should have no performance
impact in the code.

Change-Id: I7211cab3af9e9974a6ea92fc8933b73ef842829b

commit_message:
Use wsgi from oslo.service for Ironic API

oslo.service provides a wsgi functionality for defining new long-running
services using by OpenStack applications. It might usefull for working with SSL for example.

Ironic has started migrate to oslo.service, this change continue this work, and consumes wsgi from it.

Change-Id: Ic7865709cd87c45e6b7d49f15ce73354aa15401e
Closes-Bug: #1484044

commit_message:
Improve handling of client script failures

With this patch, repeat-test handles client script errors better.
It reports the error, skips testing, archives log files and
continues with the next test run.

Change-Id: Ib016c9bd496031479e36d8c20eeb9f60bbda8209

subject: Extend root device hints for different types of WWN
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-16 14:58:34.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/hardware.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_hardware.py'], 'message': 'Extend root device hints for different types of WWN

This patch is extending the root device hints to also look at
ID_WWN_WITH_EXTENSION and ID_WWN_VENDOR_EXTENSION from udev.

Prior to this patch the IPA ramdisk only cared about ID_WWN but in some
systems in some platforms with a RAID controller, this ID can be same
even if they are different disks (see bug 1516641).

Closes-Bug: #1516641
Change-Id: Ic3e9a1111dfcc99702190c173562a0dccf5f94c4
'}]
commit_message:
Extend root device hints for different types of WWN

This patch is extending the root device hints to also look at
ID_WWN_WITH_EXTENSION and ID_WWN_VENDOR_EXTENSION from udev.

Prior to this patch the IPA ramdisk only cared about ID_WWN but in some
systems in some platforms with a RAID controller, this ID can be same
even if they are different disks (see bug 1516641).

Closes-Bug: #1516641
Change-Id: Ic3e9a1111dfcc99702190c173562a0dccf5f94c4

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-13 17:44:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Fix is_volume_backed_instance() for unset image_ref

is_volume_backed_instance() assumed from old times, that if image_ref
is not set, the instance is always volume backed.  This is not true
anymore, since block device mappings can also reference images as
source.  This fix adapts the test cases and function accordingly.

Change-Id: Ie83d8d8154d372991fb37dae0def37e3f4583090
Closes-Bug: #1501851
'}]
commit_message:
Fix is_volume_backed_instance() for unset image_ref

is_volume_backed_instance() assumed from old times, that if image_ref
is not set, the instance is always volume backed.  This is not true
anymore, since block device mappings can also reference images as
source.  This fix adapts the test cases and function accordingly.

Change-Id: Ie83d8d8154d372991fb37dae0def37e3f4583090
Closes-Bug: #1501851

revisions:

Do 'GET v3/endpoints', the response should not contain 'name' and
would contain 'url'.

Do 'GET v3/policies', the response should contain the key of
'policies' rather than 'blob'. Also, it could not necessarily return

Change-Id: Icd70494b8db0dbe2d694a77bccca1280eb657c0d
"}]
commit_message:
Update response to list v3/endpoints and v3/policies in samples

Do 'GET v3/endpoints', the response should not contain 'name' and
would contain 'url'.

Do 'GET v3/policies', the response should contain the key of
'policies' rather than 'blob'. Also, it could not necessarily return
'Project_id' and 'user_id'.

Change-Id: Icd70494b8db0dbe2d694a77bccca1280eb657c0d

incorporates a few suggestions for improving the way
different signature key types are handled, in order
to make it easier to add additional supported
signature key types.

Also added the ability to verify that the certificate
valid time range includes now.

Change-Id: I695f3e279f26d70fc80f1f6623ab7f42cf094bdf
Depends-On: I1180501ff63e5148fd9e29bc4b9922fd485b6ab7
Implements: blueprint image-signing-and-verification-support

commit_message:
Update style for signature_utils class

Per reviewer comments on signature_utils, this patch
incorporates a few suggestions for improving the way
different signature key types are handled, in order
to make it easier to add additional supported
signature key types.

Also added the ability to verify that the certificate
valid time range includes now.

Change-Id: I695f3e279f26d70fc80f1f6623ab7f42cf094bdf
Depends-On: I1180501ff63e5148fd9e29bc4b9922fd485b6ab7
Implements: blueprint image-signing-and-verification-support

commit_message:
Add optional 'defer_reverts' behavior

This makes it possible to REVERT a subflow
and have it also revert the parent flow if
the parent flow doesn't have its own retry
strategy. We will probably want to make this
new behavior the default or only behavior
in a future release.

Change-Id: Iea5ac366380ba7396a87d0185703549fb0c2f825

commit_message:
Import ml2_odl options in opendaylight mechanism driver

ml2_odl group options must be imported before being
used in mechanism driver.

In addition, we update other opendaylight drivers way
of imporing ml2_odl options accordingly.

Change-Id: Ia11201eae7546f15064a4e45ac84226ea64da0fd
Closes-bug: 1516966

commit_message:
Move kombu as a test dependency only

oslo.messaging has kombu in its own requirements, so kombu
is not needed in requirements.txt.
Instead it was moved to test-requirements.txt file because
it is explicitly imported for functionnal tests.

Change-Id: I952263f1d2c61a3b700824914da499b1ece91b78

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-11-18 03:58:50.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/securitygroups_db.py', 'etc/neutron.conf', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_securitygroup.py'], 'message': 'Create default sg rules when create a sg

Sometimes we need to create a default security rule when a new security
group is created. The following patch facilitates the same. The format
of default security group rule is
"ethertype,direction,protocol,port_range_min,port_range_max".
For example:
security_group_default_rules=ipv4:ingress:tcp:22:22,ipv4:ingress:tcp:80:80

Related-bp: create-default-security-rules-when-creating-a-security-group

DocImpact
SecurityImpact

Change-Id: I2531506fcd3b31fc2b733ee0cc5c4911a6528e1a
'}]
commit_message:
Create default sg rules when create a sg

Sometimes we need to create a default security rule when a new security
group is created. The following patch facilitates the same. The format
of default security group rule is
"ethertype,direction,protocol,port_range_min,port_range_max".
For example:
security_group_default_rules=ipv4:ingress:tcp:22:22,ipv4:ingress:tcp:80:80

Related-bp: create-default-security-rules-when-creating-a-security-group

DocImpact
SecurityImpact

Change-Id: I2531506fcd3b31fc2b733ee0cc5c4911a6528e1a

subject: Avoid AttributeError in method _get_callback_info
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-13 03:53:40.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/notifications.py'], 'message': "Avoid AttributeError in method _get_callback_info

In method _get_callback_info, we need parameter call is
a bound method, otherwise 'callback.__self__.__class__.__name__'
will raise AttributeError. Use reflection.is_bound_method to
check callback can avoid this.

Change-Id: I7f70ce9a62735139a7310f201154513c5d6075ee
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid AttributeError in method _get_callback_info

In method _get_callback_info, we need parameter call is
a bound method, otherwise 'callback.__self__.__class__.__name__'
will raise AttributeError. Use reflection.is_bound_method to
check callback can avoid this.

Change-Id: I7f70ce9a62735139a7310f201154513c5d6075ee

commit_message:
Remove the HP CLIQ proxy driver

This patch removes the deprecated HP Lefthand
CLIQ/SSH based driver.  It also refactors the proxy
class, which was nothing but a wrapper for the 2
drivers.   The LeftHand driver is now entirely based
off of the REST client.

Implements: blueprint deprecate-hp-lefthand-cliq
DocImpact

Change-Id: I12d8bb7b7dcac8ae40796d9d169825265c634a33

service-list      Show a list of all running services.
host-describe     Describe a specific host

This covers what nova-manage service was providing so let's

commit_message:
Deprecate nova-manage service subcommand

The novaclient already has the following service commands:

service-disable   Disable the service.
service-enable    Enable the service.
service-list      Show a list of all running services.
host-describe     Describe a specific host

This covers what nova-manage service was providing so let's
deprecate the legacy nova-manage subcommand and mark it for
removal in the N release.

UpgradeImpact: nova-manage service is deprecated, use novaclient
DocImpact: update openstack operations guide

Implements: bp deprecate-service-management-in-nova-manage
Change-Id: I3e625dbf39f5831157104f5c368acd53b1899f76

We were using profile-update command to create a new profile if 'spec'
is provided. This is an abuse of the command. It is creating confusion
rather than convenience (original thought). This patch removes the
'spec' parameter so users will better understand that 'spec' is designed
to be read-only.

Change-Id: I2ee0aeea2b612dbfb27263dbf2ac203698f257e5
"}]
commit_message:
Remove spec file profile-update command

We were using profile-update command to create a new profile if 'spec'
is provided. This is an abuse of the command. It is creating confusion
rather than convenience (original thought). This patch removes the
'spec' parameter so users will better understand that 'spec' is designed
to be read-only.

Change-Id: I2ee0aeea2b612dbfb27263dbf2ac203698f257e5

commit_message:
Enable initiative action selecting in start_action

This patch adds initiative action selecting support in start_action
method of scheduler module. If no action_id is specified, the first
ready action which is not locked by other worker will be acquired
for running.

Change-Id: Id1f34e3b85148f5d1a67e099f5fcd3fbec406296
Implements: blueprint support-initiative-action-selecting-in-start-action

[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-11-17 17:06:36.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/test_api.py', 'manila/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'manila/share/api.py', 'manila/share/manager.py', 'manila/common/constants.py', 'manila/exception.py', 'manila/tests/share/test_manager.py'], 'message': 'Prevent Share operations during share migration

Disabled following operations during migration because they are
not supported:
- extend
- shrink
- delete
- create snapshot
- unmanage

This patch also changes task_state field value from MIGRATING to
MIGRATION_IN_PROGRESS, in order to better parse the string to
determine if the share is busy specifically due to migration.

Also made some small adjustments to migration code, such as moving
the action of reverting access rules to status MIGRATION_IN_PROGRESS
instead of MIGRATION_COMPLETING, in order to better fit
the migration statuses for admin diagnosis, future 2-phase
and error cleanup implementations.

is thrown on busy task_state statuses.

Closes-Bug: #1513436
Change-Id: I28123fe04b93331d82932051539aba1d9e507f68
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent Share operations during share migration

Disabled following operations during migration because they are
not supported:
- extend
- shrink
- delete
- create snapshot
- unmanage

This patch also changes task_state field value from MIGRATING to
MIGRATION_IN_PROGRESS, in order to better parse the string to
determine if the share is busy specifically due to migration.

Also made some small adjustments to migration code, such as moving
the action of reverting access rules to status MIGRATION_IN_PROGRESS
instead of MIGRATION_COMPLETING, in order to better fit
the migration statuses for admin diagnosis, future 2-phase
and error cleanup implementations.

Replaced unused ShareIsBusy exception with ShareBusyException that
is thrown on busy task_state statuses.

Closes-Bug: #1513436

commit_message:
Fix exception on uploading a volume to image with glance v2 API

This fixes an exception on uploading a volume to image when
the glance v2 api is enabled. Also, this adds the unit tests
for updating metadata and data both with glance API v1 and v2.

FakeSchema class was backported to stable/kilo too.

Change-Id: Id70eff82837c0af1f033a2bb749ef367cd9e32fb
Closes-bug: #1478737
(cherry picked from commit beef71d0f8edf5770f8fe95d85e5ea230ddd6f10)

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-11-13 18:36:32.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/opts.py', 'cinder/config/generate_cinder_opts.py', 'tools/config/check_uptodate.sh', 'tools/config/generate_sample.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Downstream Fix for Genconfig

This patch adds the opts.py file to the tree as a fix for deployers
that package cinder. The opts.py file is no longer being deleted right
away by generate_sample.sh after the cinder.sample.conf is being
generated.

This patch also introduces a pep8 check to make sure that the opts.py
file is up to date, so that it will catch when new opts get added to
Cinder without the opts.py being updated.

To support the ability to keep and check the opts file a number
of changes were needed in the check_uptodate.sh script as well as
the generate_sample.sh script:
    - check_uptodate now takes --checkopts instead of --checkonly
      When checkopts is used the opts.py file is generated using the
      current code and the generated file is compared to the existing
      file.  The check fails if there are differences.
    - generate_sample now has the --nosamplefile option.
      When this option is used, only the opts.py file is generated.
      The oslo-config-generator code is skipped so no sample file
      is created.
    - generate_sample also has some coding style consistency changes.
    - Added the 'genopts' option to tox so users can generate
      a fresh opts.py without a sample file when necessary.

Closes-Bug: 1501820
Co-Author: Jay Bryant <jsbryant@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I1f5494ebb19d5f4e8c651cbeef0acad07ad96829
"}]
commit_message:
Downstream Fix for Genconfig

This patch adds the opts.py file to the tree as a fix for deployers
that package cinder. The opts.py file is no longer being deleted right
away by generate_sample.sh after the cinder.sample.conf is being
generated.

This patch also introduces a pep8 check to make sure that the opts.py
file is up to date, so that it will catch when new opts get added to
Cinder without the opts.py being updated.

To support the ability to keep and check the opts file a number
of changes were needed in the check_uptodate.sh script as well as
the generate_sample.sh script:
    - check_uptodate now takes --checkopts instead of --checkonly
      When checkopts is used the opts.py file is generated using the
      current code and the generated file is compared to the existing
      file.  The check fails if there are differences.
    - generate_sample now has the --nosamplefile option.
      When this option is used, only the opts.py file is generated.
      The oslo-config-generator code is skipped so no sample file
      is created.
    - generate_sample also has some coding style consistency changes.
    - Added the 'genopts' option to tox so users can generate
      a fresh opts.py without a sample file when necessary.

Closes-Bug: 1501820
Co-Author: Jay Bryant <jsbryant@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I1f5494ebb19d5f4e8c651cbeef0acad07ad96829

commit_message:
Add testcases to check cache invalidation in endpoint filter extension

keystone now has the ability to cache catalog, and will invalidate
the cache when there is any change about the catalog, i.e. add endpoints
to project or remove endpoints from project. But the testcase was missed.

The patch focus on endpoint project association and leave endpoint_group
project association as it is. since these two APIs should impact the
endpoints in theory but it's doesnot in practice. So, add some testcases
to test its impact on catalog is impossible.

There is another bug filed [1] and testcases for endpoint group will be
added when that bug is fixed.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1516469

Change-Id: Ie85679111e0f8b9d00e11155594db391eb92c09f
Closes-Bug: #1516468

avoid ambiguous titles, use consistent terms,
use spelling tools when available. These sections
can help improve SEO results for content.

commit_message:
Clarify is_domain project attribute in API version 3.5

The is_domain project attribute is actually visible in the 3.5
version of the API, although it doesn't have any effect until
version 3.6.

subject: Allow in-place updates for all compatible types
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-17 21:39:20.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/update.py', 'heat_integrationtests/functional/test_create_update.py', 'heat/engine/resources/template_resource.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': "Allow in-place updates for all compatible types

We previously only allowed a resource to update in-place when the 'type'
field in the old and new templates matched. In an age of environment type
mappings, this is incorrect. Instead, allow a resource to be updated
in-place when the old and new resource plugins are of the same class, since
this is actually what determines whether handle_update is capable of
correctly updating the resource in-place.

There is a special-case for TemplateResource as we currently subclass it
for each template type, but all TemplateResource subclasses are in fact
capable of converting between each other via a stack update.

Change-Id: Iba4abf5efd9737ca6a17d8c91d5c54ab6d3f12e0
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1508115
(cherry picked from commit 98044dbd17c703e6062752f043e1cac6563e3589)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow in-place updates for all compatible types

We previously only allowed a resource to update in-place when the 'type'
field in the old and new templates matched. In an age of environment type
mappings, this is incorrect. Instead, allow a resource to be updated
in-place when the old and new resource plugins are of the same class, since
this is actually what determines whether handle_update is capable of
correctly updating the resource in-place.

There is a special-case for TemplateResource as we currently subclass it
for each template type, but all TemplateResource subclasses are in fact
capable of converting between each other via a stack update.

Change-Id: Iba4abf5efd9737ca6a17d8c91d5c54ab6d3f12e0
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1508115
(cherry picked from commit 98044dbd17c703e6062752f043e1cac6563e3589)

commit_message:
Removes support for Hyper-V Server 2008 R2

Support for Windows / Hyper-V Server 2008 R2 has been deprecated in
Liberty and it is no longer supported in Mitaka.

Removes the log warning.
Removes the usage of *utils modules using the old WMI namespace
'root/virtualization'.
Removes the CONF.hyperv.force_hyperv_utils_v1 config option.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1ec83f852d23758bc91da8fd8021b1bed34c63b3
Closes-Bug: #1508066

commit_message:
Revert "Add '--router:external' option to 'net-create'"

This reverts commit 096fd1b175085fcc3c46a248b4afb67561fd29ef.

In previous neutronclient versions, we allowed the following syntax to
set network as external: --router:external=False or --router:external=True.
Since Ibb100d54a5fd8b04ac5e1fc3a26826c695f4d951 was merged, this syntax
no longer works.

Conflicts:
	neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/network.py

Change-Id: Idbae5461dcaeff3da48d773e323977afcdc6f85e
Closes-Bug: #1451391

commit_message:
Ensure that stacks can't get stuck IN_PROGRESS

Make sure that any unexpected exceptions are handled by moving the stack to
the FAILED state.

Change-Id: Ic948c2fe5baf23c9c4ced33060f672ca9c278a19
Closes-Bug: #1492433

commit_message:
Update extend_volume API to use versionedobjects

The following patch updates extend_volume API to use
volume versionedobjects.  Changes were made to be
backwards compatible with older RPC clients.  It only
includes changes to the core cinder code.  Changes in
the drivers are left to each driver maintainer to
update.

Note that this patch DOES NOT try to use object dot
notation everywhere, since it would increase the
size of the patch.  Instead, it will be done in
subsequent patches.

Change-Id: I4192b35f8f3e2cd51b94db10b44727f23592ea86
Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-objects

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: test nova + lxc using nbd and nova-network

Relies on dca06dc7dec148cac2d9e27cdb20d7d26bb0a941 to enable nbd.

Runs nova with the libvirt + lxc backend.

Doesn't attempt to work with cells or neutron.

Only run tempest smoke tests and tell tempest to not run volume tests.

Depends on a nova change which fixes a weird bug with nova-network that
seems to really hurt the lxc case. Also depends on a debug logging patch
for the container teardown flows.

Depends-On: Ibf5333516a4c5487a3ee7c662e07028789bdd286
Depends-On: Id0cccdb5897a30eacbb3000e3b4a6b93d42e9a1f

Change-Id: I36c9d6d20c7136ba1ea24ee0921db39e74d7f5cc

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: test config for gate-tempest-dsvm-cells-neutron

Copies the same config for gate-tempest-dsvm-cells but uses
neutron instead of nova-network.

1. Has to force tempest to use fixed IP access for ssh tests.
2. Has to disable the vif plugging callback mechanism since cells
   doesn't support the os-server-events API.
3. Uses the same test regex that is in the nova tree.
4. Depends on a devstack change to disable resize tests in Tempest.
5. Depends on a nova change to skip scenario tests that use neutron
   with floating IPs.

Depends-On: I20f46024e45e32c60275703a193a56ae8cfe7eca
Depends-On: Ieb3b117449f56810f1a41fcf43e737ae919b8945

Change-Id: Idb1224da780c0aa8e35cbb80bdf02d44f5030666

This code just show how to generate swagger from nova code base.(Limited
to only show keypairs api)
There are some extend to existed decorator, schema for including the doc
in the python code.

The doc includes:
* request and response body
* query parameters
* microversion support
* expected errror status code.

More thing need TODO
* action support
* doc the parameter in the url
* reference the api samples

The problem of current nova code base
* The Microversion should declare on the top of method
* The api sample test should enable all the extensions
* We haven't schema and validation for query parameters
* We haven't schema for api response (but tempest have)

    GENERATE_SWAGGER=true tox -e functional test_api_doc

into ui:
    http://editor.swagger.io/#/

Change-Id: Ic53065c4188d1ff3cc503ea1cda6eb23e6f65fe9
"}]
commit_message:
POC: generate swagger spec from api code base

This code just show how to generate swagger from nova code base.(Limited
to only show keypairs api)
There are some extend to existed decorator, schema for including the doc
in the python code.

The doc includes:
* request and response body
* query parameters
* microversion support
* expected errror status code.

More thing need TODO
* action support
* doc the parameter in the url
* reference the api samples

The problem of current nova code base
* The Microversion should declare on the top of method
* The api sample test should enable all the extensions
* We haven't schema and validation for query parameters
* We haven't schema for api response (but tempest have)

generate swagger doc:
    GENERATE_SWAGGER=true tox -e functional test_api_doc

import swagger(nova/doc/source/swagger_specs/swagger_{api_version}.json)
into ui:
    http://editor.swagger.io/#/

Change-Id: Ic53065c4188d1ff3cc503ea1cda6eb23e6f65fe9

commit_message:
Stop using trunk python-troveclient in test runs

Because it has backward incompatible changes like:

I5ab58fd64f4745a2e558392bff649b05401ed57a

So the change here is to use the versions of troveclient
and proboscis from stable/kilo global-requirements.

Change-Id: I4c081e1ffd3ca89f613f952f056e280b909b05ce

commit_message:
Implied  Roles

When assigned a role, the user will also
be assigned all roles implied by any prior roles
The hierarchy of the roles will be expanded when
issuing a token.

DocImpact
SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Ibd84f475db464498fa9daed4454fdcd6ccd9c37c

subject: Use keystoneclient.exception directly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-12 08:02:57.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/shell.py'], 'message': "Use keystoneclient.exception directly

keystoneclient.openstack.common.apiclient.exception was import in
ironicclient/shell.py, but it's keystoneclient.exception indeed.
And only ClientException was used.

Meanwhile, apiclient is removed from oslo-incubator, so there is a
potention change in keystoneclient.

So use keystoneclient.exception directly.

Change-Id: I87bab4396996e9b4f7be33643ae49599cb2f2f76
"}]
commit_message:
Use keystoneclient.exception directly

keystoneclient.openstack.common.apiclient.exception was import in
ironicclient/shell.py, but it's keystoneclient.exception indeed.
And only ClientException was used.

Meanwhile, apiclient is removed from oslo-incubator, so there is a
potention change in keystoneclient.

So use keystoneclient.exception directly.

Change-Id: I87bab4396996e9b4f7be33643ae49599cb2f2f76

commit_message:
Add python jobs for fuel-web

This is the start of big effort to bring most of Fuel CI
to the OpenStack Infra

At this point we will add just python jobs and make sure that
they work, all jobs are non voting for now because fuel
project strucutre is going to be changed and we don't want
to block with these gates work on project.

Change-Id: I700ba93647018db42d4b4f1acd61333c1397642d

commit_message:
Refactor HP 3PAR share driver to now be HPE

This patch refactors the HP share driver to now be
the HPE share driver.

This is being done because the company responsible for
this driver is now Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE).

The driver is now located in the manila/share/drivers/hpe
folder.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint rebrand-hp-3par-share-driver
Change-Id: I36efc04fa6da088ccb06070d8cd4fe29269cd7ca

[{'number': 30, 'created': '2015-11-16 23:32:57.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/framework/widgets/toast/toast.spec.js', 'horizon/static/framework/conf/conf.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/toast/toast.service.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/openstack-service-api/policy.service.spec.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/table/images-table.controller.spec.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/static/dashboard/identity/users/table/table.controller.spec.js'], 'message': "Angular alert service - add auto dismiss

This patch auto dismisses 'info' and 'success' messages for
the Angular toast service.  It uses settings defined in
conf.js in the framework directory, which were copied over
from settings.py. We've copied over those settings
because we don't want to mix client-side settings with
other settings.  This is a first step in that goal.

To test:
1. Insert 'horizon.framework.widgets.toast.service'
as dependency (for example, into launch-instance-model.service.js)
3. Put several toastService.add(<type>, <message>);
and see that they are dismissed.
4. Also, change the auto_fade_alerts setting in conf.js
to see it adjust accordingly.

Partially Implements: blueprint launch-instance-redesign
Change-Id: I848c8e495f1a360aecc3a7353011b69aaead79e8
"}]
commit_message:
Angular alert service - add auto dismiss

This patch auto dismisses 'info' and 'success' messages for
the Angular toast service.  It uses settings defined in
conf.js in the framework directory, which were copied over
from settings.py. We've copied over those settings
because we don't want to mix client-side settings with
other settings.  This is a first step in that goal.

To test:
1. Insert 'horizon.framework.widgets.toast.service'
as dependency (for example, into launch-instance-model.service.js)
3. Put several toastService.add(<type>, <message>);
and see that they are dismissed.
4. Also, change the auto_fade_alerts setting in conf.js
to see it adjust accordingly.

Partially Implements: blueprint launch-instance-redesign
Change-Id: I848c8e495f1a360aecc3a7353011b69aaead79e8

commit_message:

Fix 10 comments and 1 message

stack.sh
  Certicate => Certificate (comment)
lib/stack
  Sentinal => Sentinel (comment)
lib/neutron-legacy
  overriden => overridden (comment)
  necesssary => necessary (comment)
  notifiy => notify (message)
  notifations => notifications (comment)
lib/rpc_backend
  orginal => original (comment)
  cofiguration => configuration (comment)
lib/stack
  confgured => configured (comment)
lib/swift
  additinal => additional (comment)
  calclution => calculation (comment)
  maximun => maximum (comment)

Change-Id: I3637388b67decb007cd49af9addecc654009559b

When adding an external network with no gateway ip to a HA router,
l3 agent will report exception. The exception comes from the code
of adding default route to HA router. However, if there is no
gateway ip in the external network, there is no need to add such

Change-Id: I41d6a292c903758f408d3d93a64dca7adeeb5769
Closes-Bug: #1515209
"}]
commit_message:
Don't add default route to HA router if there is no gateway ip

When adding an external network with no gateway ip to a HA router,
l3 agent will report exception. The exception comes from the code
of adding default route to HA router. However, if there is no
gateway ip in the external network, there is no need to add such
route.

Change-Id: I41d6a292c903758f408d3d93a64dca7adeeb5769
Closes-Bug: #1515209

commit_message:
Use unit.new_user_ref consistently

Replace all hand created user refs with calls to new_user_ref().

Note: LDAP live testing code will be updated in a follow on patch.
They require more testing before submission.

subject: Reference correct group in haproxy_config.yml
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-12 13:11:05.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/vars/configs/haproxy_config.yml'], 'message': 'Reference correct group in haproxy_config.yml

Currently, playbooks/vars/configs/haproxy_config.yml references group
metering-alarm_all, however this group is not defined in
etc/openstack_deploy/env.d.  This commit updates haproxy_config.yml
to use service group aodh_api instead.

Closes-Bug: #1512676

Change-Id: I93ac55edb15130cd1afa069a638f724be91cbe3b
(cherry picked from commit e13a76bb3aa094bfda36740b47f33cb4b722db04)
'}]
commit_message:
Reference correct group in haproxy_config.yml

Currently, playbooks/vars/configs/haproxy_config.yml references group
metering-alarm_all, however this group is not defined in
etc/openstack_deploy/env.d.  This commit updates haproxy_config.yml
to use service group aodh_api instead.

Closes-Bug: #1512676

Change-Id: I93ac55edb15130cd1afa069a638f724be91cbe3b
(cherry picked from commit e13a76bb3aa094bfda36740b47f33cb4b722db04)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-13 16:42:48.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_common.py'], 'message': '3PAR Fix find_existing_vluns

When 3PAR iSCSI driver is configured for multipath, with multiple
ip addresses in hp3par_iscsi_ips, find_existing_vluns fails to return
more than 1 vlun.  The problem with this is that every time
initialize_connection is called, the driver will not find the vlun it expects
to be there, and then it will create a new one.

This patch removes the break inside of find_existing_vluns, so that it
returns the entire list, not just the first vlun.

Change-Id: I0861745717cf9045e10a030dc25fab419f7b1f58
Closes-Bug: #1515033
'}]
commit_message:
3PAR Fix find_existing_vluns

When 3PAR iSCSI driver is configured for multipath, with multiple
ip addresses in hp3par_iscsi_ips, find_existing_vluns fails to return
more than 1 vlun.  The problem with this is that every time
initialize_connection is called, the driver will not find the vlun it expects
to be there, and then it will create a new one.

This patch removes the break inside of find_existing_vluns, so that it
returns the entire list, not just the first vlun.

Change-Id: I0861745717cf9045e10a030dc25fab419f7b1f58
Closes-Bug: #1515033

commit_message:
Add support for IP Version in Horizon FW-Rule

Currently IP Version can be specified during creation/updation
of firewall rules in CLI, but not in Horizon.
This patch adds the support for IP Version in Horizon.

Change-Id: I206c84501248c393167b060e0329dc1b0ea02f14
Closes-Bug: #1503947

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-17 03:20:05.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/engine/service/test_stack_delete.py', 'heat/tests/test_engine_service.py', 'heat/engine/stack_lock.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': 'Reset stack status even when lock engine_id is None

Having a stack which is wedged UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS due to another bug,
restarting heat-engine should have resulted in the stack being reset to
UPDATE_FAILED. However the reset was skipped because the lock engine_id
was None.

This change removes the engine_id check since it is possible in practice
for an UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS stack to not be locked.

Since it is possible for the stack to change state in the unlocked
window, a check is added that the stack is still IN_PROGRESS before the
reset is performed.

Change-Id: I1739ccbdf75af35aac5be16b99200975df58b8e2
Closes-Bug: #1514615
'}]
commit_message:
Reset stack status even when lock engine_id is None

Having a stack which is wedged UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS due to another bug,
restarting heat-engine should have resulted in the stack being reset to
UPDATE_FAILED. However the reset was skipped because the lock engine_id
was None.

This change removes the engine_id check since it is possible in practice
for an UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS stack to not be locked.

Since it is possible for the stack to change state in the unlocked
window, a check is added that the stack is still IN_PROGRESS before the
reset is performed.

Change-Id: I1739ccbdf75af35aac5be16b99200975df58b8e2
Closes-Bug: #1514615

subject: Swap Facter[].value with Facter.value()
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-13 01:05:18.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/neutron_agent_ovs/ini_setting.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron_agent_linuxbridge/ini_setting.rb'], 'message': "Swap Facter[].value with Facter.value()

  This commit swaps out the usage of Facter['operatingsystem'].value
  with Facter.value(:operatingsystem) in all neutron providers that
  use the array method on a ruby module style syntax.

  This commit doesn't actually fix anything that is broken just
  implements a specific syntax to keep consistency across Puppet
  OpenStack modules.

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/243849
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/243854

Change-Id: I623f92a5071c4e61a614319ece08b9495d83ff59
"}]
commit_message:
Swap Facter[].value with Facter.value()

  This commit swaps out the usage of Facter['operatingsystem'].value
  with Facter.value(:operatingsystem) in all neutron providers that
  use the array method on a ruby module style syntax.

  This commit doesn't actually fix anything that is broken just
  implements a specific syntax to keep consistency across Puppet
  OpenStack modules.

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/243849
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/243854

Change-Id: I623f92a5071c4e61a614319ece08b9495d83ff59

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-17 23:10:49.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/source/nova-controller-install.rst'], 'message': "[install] Fix nova controller install on Debian

This patch fixes numerous issues present in the guide for installing
nova in the controller for Debian:
- Lack of apt-get command
- Edition of nova.conf which isn't needed for things handled by debconf
(like keystone_authtoken, rabbit, and db management).

Change-Id: Id68c2eb489aec1e968047477d8efe53121e81f6f
"}]
commit_message:
[install] Fix nova controller install on Debian

This patch fixes numerous issues present in the guide for installing
nova in the controller for Debian:
- Lack of apt-get command
- Edition of nova.conf which isn't needed for things handled by debconf
(like keystone_authtoken, rabbit, and db management).

Change-Id: Id68c2eb489aec1e968047477d8efe53121e81f6f

commit_message:
doc: Update LBaaS v2 setup for Liberty

- Updated LBaaS v2 setup to use Octavia.
- Removed the old cirros image URL, the default should be sufficient.
- Fixed nova boot commands based on Liberty DevStack.
- Added sleeps to LBaaS v2 commands since most commands
  can take a few seconds to complete.
- Added wait to load balancer creation since it can take
  a few minutes to complete.
- Wrapped long lines in the descriptions.

Change-Id: Ib4a3f02ebc2606e3e16591ae3a23676cb0a6cd64

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-05 22:12:15.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': 'OVS agent: handle deleted ports on each rpc_loop iteration

Currently rpc loop processes ports only in case polling is required
(message from ovsdb monitor) or there are port_updated notifications from
server or security group notifications.
In case of just port_deleted notifications port processing is not
triggered during rpc loop.
This may lead to agent accumulating a big amount of deleted ports
and processing all of them at once during next iteration when polling is
required or any notification from server, which might be quite tough for
the agent. Tough means agent will be irresponsive while processing deleted
ports.
The patch makes port deletion processing more gradual.

Closes-Bug: #1491922
Change-Id: I0e1f6dfbf5b56fb18a978d6214e1768560d8ac98
(cherry picked from commit 6d51ef5d2e275d0d260a592d3ab8ed8a76a63421)
'}]
commit_message:
OVS agent: handle deleted ports on each rpc_loop iteration

Currently rpc loop processes ports only in case polling is required
(message from ovsdb monitor) or there are port_updated notifications from
server or security group notifications.
In case of just port_deleted notifications port processing is not
triggered during rpc loop.
This may lead to agent accumulating a big amount of deleted ports
and processing all of them at once during next iteration when polling is
required or any notification from server, which might be quite tough for
the agent. Tough means agent will be irresponsive while processing deleted
ports.
The patch makes port deletion processing more gradual.

Closes-Bug: #1491922
Change-Id: I0e1f6dfbf5b56fb18a978d6214e1768560d8ac98
(cherry picked from commit 6d51ef5d2e275d0d260a592d3ab8ed8a76a63421)

commit_message:
OVS agent: flush firewall rules for all deleted ports at once

In some cases, under high load OVS agent has to delete a big amount of
ports during rpc_loop. remove_devices_filter() does iptables-save/restore
for IPv4 and IPv6 which is 4 system calls. It is very expensive and
inefficient to call it for each port individually.

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py

Closes-Bug: #1491922
Change-Id: I4cfb2dfcef5088436c7aaae22c8f66e1ea052311
(cherry picked from commit da81ae88929c389f0ba8660c4c8dfb79eec7c0fd)

commit_message:
Remove excessive fallback iptables ACCEPT rules

The previous code was generating a fallback ACCEPT rule for every
port when there should only be one at the very end. The reason that
this wasn't causing a bug is because we have a duplicate rule remover
that was silently throwing away the extras and it happened to get them
in the right order.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/linux/iptables_firewall.py

Closes-Bug: #1502906
Change-Id: I83cf574f93b512be1ccefdc8da63e1783d279233
(cherry picked from commit ea8de8a9dd808b1379060e0ce578b8129f45c3ae)

commit_message:
[WIP] Add Network Availability to Host Mapping API

Adds API's for mapping Neutron networks to hosts for mapping availability
of a particular network on a specific host.

TODO:

- API tests
- More unit tests

Change-Id: Ie510123c65c48431b9037f06ef055533718983bc
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

commit_message:
Basic Tabs now inherit from a Bootstrap Theme

Tabs were pretty basic.  For the most, tabs were using the standard
styles nicely, except when embedded inside of a modal. There was a
lot of adding padding and removing padding to the tab-content and
modal container.  This has been cleaned up.

Also, the 'asterisk' that is used to show when a tab has required
information for a workflow was changed to an icon font.

Many unused styles were removed from horizon.scss.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg
Partially-Implements: blueprint bootstrap-html-standards

Change-Id: I929de0ae31a3c2cca9e332956eed755c4e279f3d

Change-Id: I0eb752ecf4db580838687c290ccf36810e8a4ff3

commit_message:
Get kolla path from settings when provisioning box

The path for the kolla source dir was being
hardcoded on the ubuntu-bootstrap provision script
instead of utilizing the path defined in the
PROVIDER_DEFAULTS settings in the Vagrantfile

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-09 04:34:37.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'dev/vagrant/ubuntu/Vagrantfile', 'dev/vagrant/ubuntu/bootstrap.sh'], 'message': 'Add support for ubuntu when deploying kolla with Vagrant

Created bootstrap.sh script to provision a Ubuntu base box with all dependencies necessary to run kolla
Install the following dependencies:
-docker 1.8.2
-ansible 1.9.4
-python deps

Also created separate Vagrantfile with only support for AIO deployments, focused on new comers that are not interested in multi node support out of the box

Change-Id: I81fe9f5d7ade54efce3e5152b1b67f5cf2c2996e

Signed-off-by: Diogo Monteiro <diogo.gmt@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add support for ubuntu when deploying kolla with Vagrant

Created bootstrap.sh script to provision a Ubuntu base box with all dependencies necessary to run kolla
Install the following dependencies:
-docker 1.8.2
-ansible 1.9.4
-python deps

Also created separate Vagrantfile with only support for AIO deployments, focused on new comers that are not interested in multi node support out of the box

Change-Id: I81fe9f5d7ade54efce3e5152b1b67f5cf2c2996e
Implements: blueprint vagrant-ubuntu-support
Signed-off-by: Diogo Monteiro <diogo.gmt@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fixes interface_file jinja misconfiguration

The amphora jinja templater renders the interfaces_file option with a string of 'None'.
This causes failures while communicating with the Amphora.

Change-Id: I57b16387cc84b3942f0af5fc92320513baaff76e
Closes-Bug: #1516827

commit_message:
Delete $IPV6_PUBLIC_NETWORK_GATEWAY IP during cleanup

So that it does not end up being the IP address that is picked to move
back to $PUBLIC_INTERFACE when we call _move_neutron_address_route

Closes-Bug: 1514984

Currently we cannot pass extra kwargs in scenario manager.py
_create_router method. Adding kwargs to allow scenario test case
to call create_networks to create router with extra arguments like

commit_message:
Add kwargs in scenario manager create_router

Currently we cannot pass extra kwargs in scenario manager.py
_create_router method. Adding kwargs to allow scenario test case
to call create_networks to create router with extra arguments like
distributed, etc.

Closes-Bug: #1465872
Change-Id: I6f166e0b96491cff8b5db8e6d297a9d8ddaad10d

subject: Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-16 00:23:55.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini

* Remove support for python 2.6
* Remove skipsdist : Needs to be set only if 
  sdist is expensive
* Remove usedevelop : only needed when skipsdist 
  is set to True
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override
* Remove setenv : We can just use the default as
  we don't need any extra environment variables
* Remove requirements.txt from deps, as this is
  already added automatically


Change-Id: I7e45a5aba221e9b2204264f5e88b8ef1f6bd04e3"}]
commit_message:
Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini

* Remove support for python 2.6
* Remove skipsdist : Needs to be set only if 
  sdist is expensive
* Remove usedevelop : only needed when skipsdist 
  is set to True
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override
* Remove setenv : We can just use the default as
  we don't need any extra environment variables
* Remove requirements.txt from deps, as this is
  already added automatically


Change-Id: I7e45a5aba221e9b2204264f5e88b8ef1f6bd04e3

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-08 21:15:39.000000000', 'files': ['tests-py3.txt', 'cinder/volume/drivers/zfssa/zfssanfs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/zfssa/zfssaiscsi.py'], 'message': 'Port zfssa driver to Python 3

* Replace base64.encodestring() with
  oslo_serialization.base64.encode_as_text() to accept Unicode as
  input (encoded to UTF-8). On Python 3, the function decodes base64
  from ASCII to get Unicode.
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_zfssa

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I29a1a752d4cad5796fba1f21fe88238cb4414717
'}]
commit_message:
Port zfssa driver to Python 3

* Replace base64.encodestring() with
  oslo_serialization.base64.encode_as_text() to accept Unicode as
  input (encoded to UTF-8). On Python 3, the function decodes base64
  from ASCII to get Unicode.
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_zfssa

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I29a1a752d4cad5796fba1f21fe88238cb4414717

subject: Support service client unit tests for headers also.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-13 06:12:49.000000000', 'files': ['tempest_lib/tests/services/compute/base.py', 'tempest_lib/tests/services/compute/test_images_client.py'], 'message': 'Support service client unit tests for headers also.

Some APIs like create image, returns only headers with empty response body.
We should have unit tests for those API also which required to add header
support in base service client test class.

This commit support header testing for service client and implement
create image unit tests which only return info in headers.

Change-Id: I9a79f862288e5fa827414ce1f26d80bcca4db687
'}]
commit_message:
Support service client unit tests for headers also.

Some APIs like create image, returns only headers with empty response body.
We should have unit tests for those API also which required to add header
support in base service client test class.

This commit support header testing for service client and implement
create image unit tests which only return info in headers.

Change-Id: I9a79f862288e5fa827414ce1f26d80bcca4db687

subject: determine tgtd ready status through tgtadm
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-20 12:25:52.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/extensions/iscsi.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/extensions/test_iscsi.py'], 'message': 'determine tgtd ready status through tgtadm

The intention of the iscsi extension _wait_for_iscsi_daemon function
is to wait till the tgtd process boots completely before running any
iscsi commands through the tgtadm command line utility.  The tgtd
process utilises a unix socket for communication with the user and the
_wait_for_iscsi_daemon function asserts the tgtd process status based
on the socket presence.  The socket name/path to use is not specified
by iscsi extension configuration but rather falls-back to a
(system-wide) default value[1].  Since tgtd version 1.0.60, this path
changed from /var/run/tgtd.ipc_abstract_namespace to
/var/run/tgtd/socket[2] and now causes a false-negative while waiting
for the tgtd process to boot[3].

This patch follows implementation suggestion from the bug report[3] to
avoid relying on the socket presence but rather to check the tgtd
status by trying to communicate through the tgtadm tool.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ironic-python-agent/blob/
5bbb9ded082f2cfde5e8877e9f33294eb93a5fb7/
ironic_python_agent/extensions/iscsi.py#L47 [2]
https://github.com/fujita/tgt/commit/
d1aa4dcfd691c9409dbad5db49ce6754ce9c1b5a
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic-python-agent/+bug/1505923

Closes-Bug: #1505923
Change-Id: If3284e0b441fe6c2da507640c08a4bbefd9dad2b
'}]
commit_message:
determine tgtd ready status through tgtadm

The intention of the iscsi extension _wait_for_iscsi_daemon function
is to wait till the tgtd process boots completely before running any
iscsi commands through the tgtadm command line utility.  The tgtd
process utilises a unix socket for communication with the user and the
_wait_for_iscsi_daemon function asserts the tgtd process status based
on the socket presence.  The socket name/path to use is not specified
by iscsi extension configuration but rather falls-back to a
(system-wide) default value[1].  Since tgtd version 1.0.60, this path
changed from /var/run/tgtd.ipc_abstract_namespace to
/var/run/tgtd/socket[2] and now causes a false-negative while waiting
for the tgtd process to boot[3].

This patch follows implementation suggestion from the bug report[3] to
avoid relying on the socket presence but rather to check the tgtd
status by trying to communicate through the tgtadm tool.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ironic-python-agent/blob/
5bbb9ded082f2cfde5e8877e9f33294eb93a5fb7/
ironic_python_agent/extensions/iscsi.py#L47 [2]
https://github.com/fujita/tgt/commit/
d1aa4dcfd691c9409dbad5db49ce6754ce9c1b5a
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic-python-agent/+bug/1505923

Closes-Bug: #1505923
Change-Id: If3284e0b441fe6c2da507640c08a4bbefd9dad2b

subject: Robustify locking in MessageHandlingServer
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-17 11:30:19.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_utils.py', 'oslo_messaging/tests/rpc/test_server.py', 'oslo_messaging/server.py'], 'message': "Robustify locking in MessageHandlingServer

This change formalises locking in MessageHandlingServer, which closes
several bugs:

* It adds locking for internal state when using the blocking executor,
  which closes a number of races.
* It does not hold a lock while executing server functions,
  which removes a potential cause of deadlock if the server does its
  own locking.
* It fixes a regression introduced in change
  gI3cfbe1bf02d451e379b1dcc23dacb0139c03be76. If multiple threads
  called wait() simultaneously, only 1 of them would wait and the
  others would return immediately, despite message handling not having
  completed.  With this change only 1 will call the underlying wait,
  but all will wait on its completion.

Additionally, it introduces some new functionality:

* It allows the user to make calls in any order and it will ensure,
  with locking, that these will be reordered appropriately.
* The caller can pass a `timeout` argument to any server method, which
  will cause it to raise an exception if it waits too long.
* The caller can pass a `log_after` argument to any server method,
  which will cause it to raise a log message if it waits too long. It
  can also be used to disable logging when waiting is intentional.

We remove DummyCondition as it no longer has any users.

This change was originally committed as change
I9d516b208446963dcd80b75e2d5a2cecb1187efa, but was reverted as it
caused a hang in a Nova test. This was caused by the locking behaviour
for handling restarting a previously stopped server. The original
patch caused the state to 'wrap' immediately after the user called
wait(). This caused a hang in tests which redundantly called stop()
and wait() multiple times. This new patch only wraps when the user
calls start() again. Callers who do not restart a server will
therefore not be affected by the wrapping behaviour. Callers who do
restart a server will be no worse than before. We add a deprecation
warning on restart, as this operation is inherently racy with this api
and there is a simple, safe alternative.

This new version has been successfully tested against the unit and
functional tests of nova, cinder, glance, and ceilometer.

Change-Id: Ic79f87e7b069c1f62d6121486fd6cafd732fdde7
"}]
commit_message:
Robustify locking in MessageHandlingServer

This change formalises locking in MessageHandlingServer, which closes
several bugs:

* It adds locking for internal state when using the blocking executor,
  which closes a number of races.
* It does not hold a lock while executing server functions,
  which removes a potential cause of deadlock if the server does its
  own locking.
* It fixes a regression introduced in change
  gI3cfbe1bf02d451e379b1dcc23dacb0139c03be76. If multiple threads
  called wait() simultaneously, only 1 of them would wait and the
  others would return immediately, despite message handling not having
  completed.  With this change only 1 will call the underlying wait,
  but all will wait on its completion.

Additionally, it introduces some new functionality:

* It allows the user to make calls in any order and it will ensure,
  with locking, that these will be reordered appropriately.
* The caller can pass a `timeout` argument to any server method, which
  will cause it to raise an exception if it waits too long.
* The caller can pass a `log_after` argument to any server method,
  which will cause it to raise a log message if it waits too long. It
  can also be used to disable logging when waiting is intentional.

We remove DummyCondition as it no longer has any users.

This change was originally committed as change
I9d516b208446963dcd80b75e2d5a2cecb1187efa, but was reverted as it
caused a hang in a Nova test. This was caused by the locking behaviour
for handling restarting a previously stopped server. The original
patch caused the state to 'wrap' immediately after the user called
wait(). This caused a hang in tests which redundantly called stop()
and wait() multiple times. This new patch only wraps when the user
calls start() again. Callers who do not restart a server will
therefore not be affected by the wrapping behaviour. Callers who do
restart a server will be no worse than before. We add a deprecation
warning on restart, as this operation is inherently racy with this api
and there is a simple, safe alternative.

This new version has been successfully tested against the unit and
functional tests of nova, cinder, glance, and ceilometer.

Change-Id: Ic79f87e7b069c1f62d6121486fd6cafd732fdde7

Fix method dvr_update_router_addvm to notify every

on.

In dvr case, when a subnet only attaches to one router,
the subnet will only have one distributed router interface,
which device_owner is "network:router_interface_distributed".

one port, and it should be unnecessary to break in for loop.

commit_message:
Fix dvr update for subnet attach multi subnets

Fix method dvr_update_router_addvm to notify every
router attached to subnet where the vm will boot
on.

In dvr case, when a subnet only attaches to one router,
the subnet will only have one distributed router interface,
which device_owner is "network:router_interface_distributed".
So in this case, get_ports in this method will only get
one port, and it should be unnecessary to break in for loop.

But when a subnet attaches multiple routers, get_ports in
this method will return all distributed router interfaces
and the routers hold those interfaces should be notified
when an instance booted on the subnet. So it should also
be unnecessary to break in for loop.

Closes-Bug: #1427122
Co-Authored-By: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>
(cherry picked from commit 24fa37e05544316b58357b753360b147878e5d94)

Conflicts:
	neutron/db/l3_dvrscheduler_db.py
	neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py
Change-Id: I3a5808e5b6e8b78abd1a5b924395844507da0764

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-03 16:23:58.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Cap requests at <2.8.0 since it packages urllib3 1.12

We have a cap set on urllib3 at 1.11 and requests 2.8.0, released on
10/6, packages urllib3 1.12, which introduces a conflict.

So cap requests at 2.8.0 to avoid issues with newer urllib3.

Since python-glanceclient depends on requests this will need to sync to
glanceclient on stable/kilo and then we can do a patch version release
of that library.

Partial-Bug: #1476770

Change-Id: I8ff76853220c10565b06ba74a7c75c5a955e871b
'}]
commit_message:
Cap requests at <2.8.0 since it packages urllib3 1.12

We have a cap set on urllib3 at 1.11 and requests 2.8.0, released on
10/6, packages urllib3 1.12, which introduces a conflict.

So cap requests at 2.8.0 to avoid issues with newer urllib3.

Since python-glanceclient depends on requests this will need to sync to
glanceclient on stable/kilo and then we can do a patch version release
of that library.

Partial-Bug: #1476770

Change-Id: I8ff76853220c10565b06ba74a7c75c5a955e871b

commit_message:
[V3] Make service_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes service_client use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I02242ad94989ae234963014aa58ffe7b3787018d

commit_message:
Validate ethertype for icmp protocols

This patch will add the validation function to make sure security_group
rule is not created when ethertype is IPv4 and protocol is icmpv6.

Closes-Bug: #1505832
Depends-On: Ia1a5342a1d568cb1a015e1b7acecf38b8d1f46e1

Co-Authored By: Matt Dorn <madorn@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I4a15935c564aaa48555ed08f6da51113787ecb73
(cherry picked from commit 7335dbdabe6cd2d558f209b2349491efc376352e)

commit_message:
More graceful ovs-agent restart

When the neutron server is down/busy the agent is not able to get any
port info. After the agent restarts, it will not install any new flow.
Cleaning the existing flows will break all networking until the agent
succeeds to sync with the neturon server.

This patch ensures the agent cleans the stale flows only after it
succeeds to sync with the neturon server.

Change-Id: I763fc06a73b6d2f010da65e74241182636dda44d
Closes-bug: #1515075
(cherry picked from commit 0c8121ee68085d67a7b865b5b25c4b3880defc89)

commit_message:
Fix H404/405 violations for scenario tests

There is a lot of H404/405 violations in Tempest now, and that leads
difficult to migrate the code to tempest-lib or the other projects'
repos. This patch fixes these violations for scenario tests.

Change-Id: Ia2b3cdbd0da49eeb16742c1eed05ea56ca41a8f7

commit_message:
Remove novaclient/neutronclient description

When we implemented scenario tests, we were using novaclient and
the other client for doing that. But now we don't use novaclient/
neutronclient at all.
So this patch removes novaclient/neutronclient description.

Change-Id: Ic6c6d9fa3ce36327f4f06d1a33a291c057a9f5bc
