subject: Support partial upgrades of Neutron in DVR mode.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-09 13:24:27.000000000', 'files': ['projects/50_neutron/upgrade.sh', 'projects/50_neutron/shutdown.sh'], 'message': 'Support partial upgrades of Neutron in DVR mode.

When Neutron is running in DVR mode, we need to leave both the L2 and
L3 agents running.  This patch takes advantage of new support in
DevStack that allows separate control of the L3 agent.

Change-Id: I9bc9fdc233114411f78276b3abc1ca8cf33ef52e
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
Depends-on: I392a84790d4282edc52edd16502907dfeaefd41e
'}]
commit_message:
Support partial upgrades of Neutron in DVR mode.

When Neutron is running in DVR mode, we need to leave both the L2 and
L3 agents running.  This patch takes advantage of new support in
DevStack that allows separate control of the L3 agent.

Change-Id: I9bc9fdc233114411f78276b3abc1ca8cf33ef52e
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
Depends-on: I392a84790d4282edc52edd16502907dfeaefd41e

commit_message:
Support partial Neutron upgrades.

We test nova without upgrading nova-compute to cover the rolling
compute node upgrade scenario.  To test the same scenario for a
deployment that includes Neutron, we need to be able to upgrade
everything except the Neutron L2 agent.

Change-Id: Id8e8985eb51813a07843a87ce114f3d68a98194e
Depends-on: I7eb87fba778aff3e4514813c6232dafa99ee2912
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-09-06 15:35:04.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron-legacy'], 'message': 'Separate start/stop control of the Neutron L3 agent.

This patch is in support of adding rolling compute node upgrade
testing with Neutron enabled.  In the case of running Neutron in DVR
mode, compute nodes will also be running the L3 agent, so we need to
be able to control that agent separately, as well.

Change-Id: I392a84790d4282edc52edd16502907dfeaefd41e
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Separate start/stop control of the Neutron L3 agent.

This patch is in support of adding rolling compute node upgrade
testing with Neutron enabled.  In the case of running Neutron in DVR
mode, compute nodes will also be running the L3 agent, so we need to
be able to control that agent separately, as well.

Change-Id: I392a84790d4282edc52edd16502907dfeaefd41e
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

subject: neutron: Stop using deprecated option name.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-04 19:42:01.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron-legacy'], 'message': 'neutron: Stop using deprecated option name.

When q-svc starts, the log contains the following warning:

2015-09-04 19:38:13.282 WARNING oslo_config.cfg [-] Option "username"
from group "nova" is deprecated. Use option "user-name" from group
"nova".

This patch makes the recommended change so that devstack no longer
configures neutron with the deprecated option name.

Change-Id: I128946570d755e12346ec7b11fe8fc8c40a8611c
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
neutron: Stop using deprecated option name.

When q-svc starts, the log contains the following warning:

2015-09-04 19:38:13.282 WARNING oslo_config.cfg [-] Option "username"
from group "nova" is deprecated. Use option "user-name" from group
"nova".

This patch makes the recommended change so that devstack no longer
configures neutron with the deprecated option name.

Change-Id: I128946570d755e12346ec7b11fe8fc8c40a8611c
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-10-19 15:47:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_hostops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_vmops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_utilsfactory.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_livemigrationops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_snapshotops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_base.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_volumeops.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/utilsfactory.py'], 'message': 'Hyper-V: refactors utilsfactory

The Hyper-V API can change from a version to another (e.g. new
features), requiring a new Utils class to be added for specific
versions.

Refactors utilsfactory module. In this way, a new utils class
can be added without adding a new parameter when retrieving the
suitable class for windows version.

Change-Id: I1ea398473947a0d9afea08c08fea09dc09afea09
'}]
commit_message:
Hyper-V: refactors utilsfactory

The Hyper-V API can change from a version to another (e.g. new
features), requiring a new Utils class to be added for specific
versions.

Refactors utilsfactory module. In this way, a new utils class
can be added without adding a new parameter when retrieving the
suitable class for windows version.

Change-Id: I1ea398473947a0d9afea08c08fea09dc09afea09

that is used in networking templates tests

commit_message:
Make libvirt migration security configurable

Adding flags to choose between tls/tcp connections as well as
sasl/none authentication when configuring libvirt migration.

This allows to deploy proper libvirt security in combination with
the nova::compute class.

Change-Id: Ib479a1f4cd2df0d55347ed71fb8f0ab69aaeceef

Set additional environment variable for HTTPS
proxy and enable insecure mode for SSL, because
in tests we use self-signed certificate.

commit_message:
Bring corosync cluster to maintenance mode

To fix quorum loss tests should bring corosync cluster to maintenance mode
in following tests:
* ha_neutron_check_alive_rabbit
* ha_neutron_check_dead_rabbit
* ha_nova_check_alive_rabbit
* ha_nova_check_dead_rabbit

Change-Id: Ia185a12457d08e7ce7bba9d800a555f31e6e60c8
Closes-Bug: #1462942

commit_message:
Fix gate job for ostf repo

The thing is that nailgun tests require postgresql backend to
be available. So, we need to prepare it before running tests.
Fortunately, all unit tests are run on nodes where postgresql
is installed.

Change-Id: I8f93bb78cb4144f993fb55936e157b5fe153a4c1
Closes-Bug: #1516609

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-22 10:56:13.000000000', 'files': ['test/test_lockfile.py', 'lockfile/linklockfile.py', 'lockfile/__init__.py', 'lockfile/mkdirlockfile.py', 'lockfile/pidlockfile.py', 'lockfile/symlinklockfile.py', 'tox.ini', 'lockfile/sqlitelockfile.py', 'test/compliancetest.py'], 'message': 'Fix flake8 warnings

* Remove trailing spaces
* test_lockfile.py: add "# noqa" on the sqlite3 import, the import is

Change-Id: I8218785f5cea23532357ec1756a3ab2255880d74

commit_message:
Fix flake8 warnings

* Remove unused imports
* Add empty lines to respect the PEP8
* Sort imports
* Replace "timeout/10" with "timeout / 10" (add spaces)
* Fix style of comments
* Remove trailing spaces
* test_lockfile.py: add "# noqa" on the sqlite3 import, the import is
  used to decide if we skip the test or not
* tox.ini: enable all warnings except F841 (which will be fixed
  later)

Change-Id: I8218785f5cea23532357ec1756a3ab2255880d74

subject: Implements more smart retrying
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-11-12 21:06:11.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_pika.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/pika_driver/pika_engine.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/pika_driver/pika_message.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/pika_driver/pika_listener.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/pika_driver/pika_poller.py'], 'message': 'Implements more smart retrying

This patch makes difference between messages which are sent
with retry=0 and retry!=0. In first case we consider that
request could be not idempotent and we should guarantee
that such messages we be not sent more then one time.
Therefore we use consuming without acknowledgements for such
messages and consuming with acknowledgements for messages which
could be processed twice to avoid message loses

Change-Id: I7dc1705e84dc6a7671bf1f379d4ef4980e41491e
'}]
commit_message:
Implements more smart retrying

This patch makes difference between messages which are sent
with retry=0 and retry!=0. In first case we consider that
request could be not idempotent and we should guarantee
that such messages we be not sent more then one time.
Therefore we use consuming without acknowledgements for such
messages and consuming with acknowledgements for messages which
could be processed twice to avoid message loses

Change-Id: I7dc1705e84dc6a7671bf1f379d4ef4980e41491e

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-17 12:40:43.000000000', 'files': ['manila/api/contrib/quotas.py'], 'message': 'Fix typo on quota limit error message

There is a typo on the error message that is shown when the user
tries to increase the user quota limit above the tenant quota
limit. This patch changes the error message from:

"Quota limit must less than %s."

to:

"Quota limit must be less than %s."

Closes-bug: #1516997
'}]
commit_message:
Fix typo on quota limit error message

There is a typo on the error message that is shown when the user
tries to increase the user quota limit above the tenant quota
limit. This patch changes the error message from:

"Quota limit must less than %s."

to:

"Quota limit must be less than %s."

Change-Id: I826faf54ffeb7be647c76dde4bbd02db67c0c115
Closes-bug: #1516997

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-16 21:10:07.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Make TripleO jobs run not only on master and remove noop-jobs

Until recently TripleO didn't maintain stable branches, but now we
do, so we need the gate jobs to work also on stable/liberty branches.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/240938/ aimed to enable this, but I
think this constraint is preventing the jobs running, e.g see:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/245670/

Also, after IRC discussion it was noted that we have a spurious
noop-jobs defined, where check jobs do exist, so remove this.

Change-Id: Ic5e6c442b4fd89776a3c18da75cd85438a52400c
"}]
commit_message:
Make TripleO jobs run not only on master and remove noop-jobs

Until recently TripleO didn't maintain stable branches, but now we
do, so we need the gate jobs to work also on stable/liberty branches.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/240938/ aimed to enable this, but I
think this constraint is preventing the jobs running, e.g see:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/245670/

Also, after IRC discussion it was noted that we have a spurious
noop-jobs defined, where check jobs do exist, so remove this.

Change-Id: Ic5e6c442b4fd89776a3c18da75cd85438a52400c

commit_message:
Add new crumb-style menu.

Adds a new crumb-style menu, providing a link to the previously
hidden tests page, and presenting hierarchical navigation to users.
A new directive is added which can be placed within page headers
to create a breadcrumb menu to which pages can add their own
additional entries.

Change-Id: I1d31ee98f7c9fe27e6bd610adc6f4bce8097d5b6

The OptGroup help text can now be generated. The precondition is
that the OptGroup objects get provided in the "list_opts" interface.
Because OptGroup objects are not sortable, we use their name for the
sorting. This allows also to provide a mixture of OptGroup objects and
OptGroup names for "list_opts".

Closed Bug: #1395819

(Co-)Author: Chris Hoge <chris@openstack.org>
Cherry-picked from commit c99822795c5c97864492ad04c77c6b79801c1e1f
and slightly changed.
Change-Id: I3cbdaa7e5dfb75d4c9eb687e68d3a35e61550d1b
'}]
commit_message:
Add help text generation for OptGroups

The OptGroup help text can now be generated. The precondition is
that the OptGroup objects get provided in the "list_opts" interface.
Because OptGroup objects are not sortable, we use their name for the
sorting. This allows also to provide a mixture of OptGroup objects and
OptGroup names for "list_opts".

Closed Bug: #1395819

(Co-)Author: Chris Hoge <chris@openstack.org>
Cherry-picked from commit c99822795c5c97864492ad04c77c6b79801c1e1f
and slightly changed.
Change-Id: I3cbdaa7e5dfb75d4c9eb687e68d3a35e61550d1b

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-16 18:45:49.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/nailgun/spec/classes/nginx_service_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/nailgun/templates/nginx.conf.erb'], 'message': 'Fix clickjacking attack vulnerability in nginx

For Fuel web interface and other sites served by nginx on fuel master
we should use X-Frame-Options SAMEORIGIN to prevent from clickjacking,
e.g. the page can only be displayed in a frame on the same
origin as the page itself.

Change-Id: Ie8d6e4e92222ac9bb7c489dd0a5aff833fabe873
Closes-Bug: #1497194
'}]
commit_message:
Fix clickjacking attack vulnerability in nginx

For Fuel web interface and other sites served by nginx on fuel master
we should use X-Frame-Options SAMEORIGIN to prevent from clickjacking,
e.g. the page can only be displayed in a frame on the same
origin as the page itself.

Change-Id: Ie8d6e4e92222ac9bb7c489dd0a5aff833fabe873
Closes-Bug: #1497194

revisions:
[{'number': 32, 'created': '2015-11-17 10:23:40.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/objects/serializers/network_configuration.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/api/v1/validators/json_schema/networks.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/db/sqlalchemy/models/network_config.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_migration_fuel_8_0.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/fixtures/openstack.yaml', 'nailgun/nailgun/api/v1/validators/json_schema/base_types.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/consts.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/orchestrator/neutron_serializers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_network_models.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_network_configuration_validator.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/db/deadlock_detector.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/fuel_8_0.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/objects/cluster.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_orchestrator_serializer_70.py'], 'message': '[Ironic] Add baremetal network for ironic

This change adds:
* new optional baremetal network
* baremetal sections in Neutron L3 configuration

Ironic requires separate baremetal network on infra nodes and neutron flat
network mapped to this physical network.

New baremetal network is optional and depends on Ironic component enabled in
settings.

Implements: blueprint fuel-integrate-ironic (partially)
Change-Id: I742bf69d3f3ac5e4b4ecd39a12e3171c566563e8
'}]
commit_message:
[Ironic] Add baremetal network for ironic

This change adds:
* new optional baremetal network
* baremetal sections in Neutron L3 configuration

Ironic requires separate baremetal network on infra nodes and neutron flat
network mapped to this physical network.

New baremetal network is optional and depends on Ironic component enabled in
settings.

Implements: blueprint fuel-integrate-ironic (partially)
